intro: Teucrium athoum, commonly known as white germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually white or pale blue, arranged in dense spikes. It is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
